ccre.cluck_old

Class CluckNetworkedServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • ccre.concurrency.ReporterThread
        • ccre.cluck_old.CluckNetworkedServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class CluckNetworkedServer
extends ReporterThread
    The server for Cluck, allows clients to connect to it and transfer data.
    See Also:
    CluckNetworkedClient

    • Constructor Detail

      • CluckNetworkedServer

        public CluckNetworkedServer(int port,
                    CluckNode serv)
                     throws java.io.IOException
        Start a new server on the specified port that provides the specified CluckNode.
        Parameters:
        port - the port to use, probably 80.
        serv - the CluckNode to transfer data from/to.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if an IO error occurs.

    • Method Detail

      • threadBody

        protected void threadBody()
                   throws java.lang.Throwable
        Description copied from class: ReporterThread
        The body of the thread. This will be called when the thread starts. This is guarenteed to be called precisely once by the ReporterThread.
        Specified by:
        threadBody in class ReporterThread
        Throws:
        java.lang.Throwable - if something goes wrong. this will be caught by the ReporterThread automatically.
